column4: what command do I use to find out what DRIVERS I already have installed and/or need for otherwise non-functioning devices?
use lsmod to see what modules are loaded
ah ha.  And I'd do "lsmod | grep "DEVICE" for the device I'm trying to troubleshoot, like "Keyboard" or "Touchpad" . . . yes?
mmm
well its not that clear
coz the usally have wierd name
like usb_hid or somthing
i think there is a list of the module.o files in lib
how do I specifically troubleshoot a laptop keyboard and touchpad under 10.10 that are non-functioning?
whtch is a list of all thye avilible drivers
or rather kernal modules
well that problem is more likly todo with your xorg conf
cd /etc/; find | grep  -i xorg
I was under the impression that 10.10 doesn't have a static xorg.conf anymore . . . it's all been moved out of reach of an "Average User".
really?
nfi
well that command i put should find it if its still in /etc/ somwhere
yeah, it's gone from 10.04 too.
you CAN have one, and the system will default to it, but by system intsall default . . . it's gone.
you will probably need one that is slighly customised to your laptop
okay . . . urgh . . . I was trying to avoid that.  Thanks!
i would reccomend searching google for one
